body: On a related note, if you're using Propshaft you might notice a Trix JS file gets created and digested. This is related to loading `actiontext`. That was discovered by a Propshaft contributer in https://github.com/rails/propshaft/issues/227#issuecomment-2579451511.

I don't see a good path here that makes sense given that Trix is a requirement of Action Text, and therefore can't ship without this. Then we're talking about extracting Action Text, which I'd not be in favor of. In fact, I'd rather do the opposite, and double down on Action Text with a Markdown option as well (we're developing such an editor in-house).

Happy to discuss other options, but just yanking Trix is not a viable one in my book.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.
The resources of the Rails team are limited, and so we are asking for your help.
If you can still reproduce this error on the `8-0-stable` branch or on `main`, please reply with all of the information you have about it in order to keep the issue open.
Thank you for all your contributions.

Picking this back up. Chatted with @dhh and I think we're all aligned on extracting it into a gem (rather than vendor it directly in Rails) to allow applications to bump Trix (to patch releases) without Rails needing to be released.

issue.body:
ref: https://github.com/rails/rails/issues/54148

Directory "action_text-trix" contains a gem that is a Rails engine providing Trix assets (js and css files).

When cutting a release, there is a rake task "sync" provided by action_text-trix/Rakefile to copy Trix files from the build directory into the gem directory. See action_text-trix/README.md for more information.

A note on naming: "trix" is already taken, as is "trix-rails", "trix_rails", "trix_on_rails", and "trix-gem". But also, this gem should really only ever be used as an implicit dependency of Rails and Action Text, so naming is less important than it otherwise might be.

I've emailed the owner of "trix" to see if they would be willing to give up the name, but at this point I think I've decided it doesn't matter a whole lot.

The accompanying Rails PR will look something like this: https://github.com/flavorjones/rails/pull/1

issue.body:
### Motivation / Background

Currently Trix is vendored in Rails, meaning that when bug fixes or security patches are released, application developers cannot easily update to the latest Trix without waiting for a Rails release.

This situation was originally described in #54148 after a Rails security team discussion.



### Detail

Drop vendored Trix files in favor of the (pending) `action_text-trix` gem, which itself vendors just the Trix assets.

issue.title: Drop vendored Trix files in favor of the `action_text-trix` gem
issue.body:
### Motivation / Background

Currently Trix is vendored in Rails, meaning that when bug fixes or security patches are released, application developers cannot easily update to the latest Trix without waiting for a Rails release.

This situation was originally described in #54148 after a Rails security team discussion.



### Detail

Drop vendored Trix files in favor of the [`action_text-trix` gem](https://rubygems.org/gems/action_text-trix), which itself vendors just the Trix assets. This gem will be maintained by the Trix maintainers at 37signals.

Closes #54148
